name: European 'Far Fetched' Places Online Quiz | Europe - Travel | 10 Questions

questions.text: Farnworth is an English township in the Bolton Metropolitan area. What does the name 'Farnworth' mean?
options: It was named after farmer William Ort
questions.explanation:
The enclosure among the ferns.

	The township area was overrun with ferns, according to writings from 1787.

questions.text: This city is the capital of the Portuguese province of Algarve and a popular tourist destination. What is it called?
questions.explanation:
Faro.

	Once an important Moorish sea port in the Iberian Peninsula, Faro was captured by the Portuguese in 1249. The city was virtually destroyed by the great earthquake of 1755. It now serves as an arrival and departure point for the 'sun-seekers' who visit the Algarve each year.

questions.text: One of the attractions of Fareham, an English sea-side town on the south coast, is its Victorian fort. What is it called?
questions.explanation:
Fort Nelson.

	Fort Nelson was built along Porstdown Hill, and it was erected in order to protect Portsmouth and the coastal area from attack. It is now a tourist attraction which houses one of the largest artillery collections in England.

questions.text: The Belgian town of Farciennes is in which province?
questions.explanation:
Hainaut.

	The Belgian provinces were organized initially according to the time it would take a horse and rider to reach a city. In other words, a man should be able to reach a city, on horseback, within one half day, from the furthest part of the district or province. This was so he could pay his taxes.

questions.text: What is the name given to the body of water that separates the Swedish Islands of Gotland and Faro?
questions.explanation:
Farosund.

	Faro Island is north east of Gotland in the Baltic Sea.

questions.text: What special event takes place biannually in the town of Farnborough, England?
questions.explanation:
Farnborough International Airshow.

	The prestigious event in the 'airshow calendar' is sponsored by the British Aerospace Companies.

questions.text: What is the 'crop' that the Farsala region of Greece is known for cultivating?
questions.explanation:
Cotton.

	The Union of Agricultural Co-operatives of Farsala, a cotton growers union, has over 7,000 members.

questions.text: Farnham is a Georgian market town in which English county?
questions.explanation:
Surrey.

	Farnham, just an hour or so drive from London, is a quaint town with a castle dating back to the 12th century.

questions.text: This beautiful Norwegian city celebrated its 200th anniversary as a town in 1995. What is it called?
questions.explanation:
Farsund.

	The coastline near Farsund is dotted with hundreds of tiny islands, making the region one of the most scenic in Norway.

questions.text: What is the capital of the Faroe Islands?
questions.explanation:
Torshavn.

	The 18 island group is in the North Atlantic. The other choices are all locations in the Outer Hebrides.
